H0.text: The chemical elements that compose animals and plants die with the animal or plant when the animal or plant dies.

H1.text: When animals and plants die, the chemical elements that make them up evaporate into the atmosphere.

H2.text: They are recycled back into the environment when animals and plants die.

H3.text: They change into different elements when animals and plants die, because animals and plants are made up of a number of different chemical elements.

A4.text: Decomposition is the process by which dead organic substances are broken down into simpler organic or inorganic matter such as carbon dioxide, water, simple sugars and mineral salts.

A5.text: The process is a part of the nutrient cycle and is essential for recycling the finite matter that occupies physical space in the biosphere.
